item.title: Officials: Two children taken from Meigs found safe, two people arrested
item.description: The Thomas County Sheriff’s Office confirmed two children taken from Meigs were found safe.

item.title: WATCH LIVE: Charlie Kirk memorial event
item.description: To honor the life and legacy of Charlie Kirk.

item.title: “His message is going to live on forever.” Hundreds gather to honor the life of Charlie Kirk in Englewood
item.description: “People really felt connected to him,” event organizer Angela Guelfi said. “I wanted our whole town to come together to have a space where they could honor Charlie Kirk,” she added.

item.title: Florida lawmakers revisit property taxes amid rising costs
item.description: The House Property Tax Select Committee is set to meet on Monday to hear presentations on how local dollars fund essential services, including schools and rural communities.

item.title: 230 people arrested in Polk County human trafficking operation
item.description: Florida Attorney General James Uthmeier announced 230 people were arrested in a major human trafficking operation.

item.title: Sheriff’s office investigates death after a man was found off Siesta Key Beach
item.description: Investigators were told that an unresponsive male swimmer was found on Siesta Key. The swimmer was pulled from the gulf by passersby.

item.title: Today is the first day of fall
Palmetto man arrested after girlfriend fatally shot, police say
item.description: The victim was found with a gunshot wound to the head.

item.title: Punta Gorda synagogue fire investigated as arson, possible hate crime
item.description: “We have allotted extra resources to be in the area to help protect our Punta Gorda Jewish community.”

item.title: Deadline to apply for Florida bear hunt permits ends tonight
item.description: The deadline to apply for a 2025 bear harvest permit is 11:59 p.m. tonight.

item.title: VIDEO: Bradenton, Tampa authorities report citizens hitting helicopters with lasers
item.description: Laser strikes on aircraft remain a serious threat to safety, the FAA says.
